hypothesis_content.title: Coinbase Stock Catalyst → Asymmetric Beta Play in Low BTC Correlation Regime
hypothesis_content.statement: During periods where the 10-day rolling correlation between BTC and COIN stock is below 0.3, a significant catalyst for COIN (e.g., stock-trading rollout, legal news) will trigger an amplified, lagged move in BTC of the same direction, as the market re-prices the 'equity proxy' relationship.
hypothesis_content.rationale: COIN is a key regulated gateway and sentiment proxy for crypto. When its correlation with BTC breaks down, the market may be under-pricing their fundamental link. A major COIN-specific catalyst forces a re-evaluation of this link, causing capital to flow into/out of the underlying asset (BTC) with a lag as the narrative spreads from equity to crypto-native traders.
entry_conditions: COIN stock has a >8% absolute move on the day (catalyst event)
BTC has not yet moved >3% in the same direction on the day (lag present)

exit_conditions.take_profit: BTC moves >5% in the direction of the COIN move
exit_conditions.stop_loss: BTC moves >2% in the *opposite* direction of the COIN move
exit_conditions.time_exit: 36 hours after the COIN catalyst close

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: COIN catalysts in low-correlation regimes produce no statistically significant directional bias in BTC price over the subsequent 36 hours.
